intro: Hypolytrum espiritosantense, commonly known as the Espirito Santo grass, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
